body_content.explanation: a note in a book or document that tells you to look somewhere else in the book or document for more information:
examples: I have to correct the page proofs and check the cross-references.
There are cross-references to the basic recipes at the beginning of the book.
If cross-references from one article to another would be helpful, add them.

body_content.explanation: to check one piece of information against another:
examples: By cross-referencing the responses to the statements, the test reveals a person's willingness to lie.
The information can be cross referenced with police records, allowing researchers to draw a complete profile of a disappeared person.
You spend a lot of time fact checking and cross referencing.

body_content.explanation: to add a cross-reference to a book or document:
examples: Individual entries are cross-referenced to many other entries in the encyclopedia.
Synonyms are not included in the descriptions, but are cross-referenced from the main listing.
Cross-referencing was very difficult because the data was not tagged in any way.
